Whether you're aspiring to be an artist or a marine biologist, an educator or a writer,                      at the University of South Carolina Beaufort, you'll discover an educational experience                      at a truly affordable price. With more than 2,000 students attending three campusesÃ¢ÂÂBluffton,                      Beaufort, and Hilton Head IslandÃ¢ÂÂour state-of-the-art facilities are some of the best,                      which makes it easy to see why The Chronicle of Higher Education named USCB among                      the top 5 fastest growing undergraduate universities in the nation!
We believe you have a powerful future ahead of you. It's time to discover it.

The Bluffton campus, University of South Carolina Beaufort's main campus, features                      200 acres of newly constructed facilities and amenities needed for a successful college                      life. There are ten fully furnished, apartment-style residence halls featuring common                      living area, full kitchen and a washer and dryer in each apartment.

, located 30 minutes from Bluffton, dates back to 1795 and houses USCB's Beaufort                         College Honors programs and Visual Art and Design.  The Beaufort College Honors (BCH)                         program is a residential cohort, designed to offer a shared experience with students                         living together, studying together and having specific experiences to enhance learning,                         improve engagement, and develop a sense of community.  BCH will offer programs in                         Biology, Lowcountry Studies and Nursing.  Students living on this campus take advantage                         of the beautiful views of the Intercoastal Waterway and the opportunity to walk with                         friends to quaint shops, art galleries, and restaurants.   This campus features new                         modern apartment-style living available to students.

The new Hilton Head Island campus opening in the fall of 2018 will give junior and                      senior hospitality management students the opportunity to study and intern in one                      of the most exciting tourist destinations in the country.  The new campus will feature                      a demonstration kitchen, beverage lab and state-of-the art classrooms.
